Authors: Putri N.K.S., Qing C.H.G., Kuncoro E.A., Goenadi E.
Title: Evaluation of Knowledge Management System Using House of Quality Method in Private Banking Industry
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Business Information Technology Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Putri, N.K.S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Qing, C.H.G., Business Information Technology Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kuncoro, E.A., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Goenadi, E., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this paper is to describe the evaluation of knowledge management system (KMS) using House of Quality Method for several branches of private banking industry in Indonesia. The high-level house of quality matrix was modified and used as a tool to evaluate the ongoing KMS implementation. Additionally, the Infosys KM Maturity Model was applied to determine its maturity level. Targeted result for this study is to form a recommendation for KMS implementation in the organization, especially in the private banking industry. KMS spread to various business field. It becomes an obligation for every organization to manage its knowledge flow and drive it to achieve innovation. As an industry with huge amount of knowledge come in and out daily, banking industry need to take their KMS to another level. By evaluating its KMS periodically, organization may improve the performance, quality and maturity level of its KMS. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: HoQ; house of quality; KMS; knowledge management system; private banking industry
Index Keywords: Houses; Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Banking industry; Evaluation of knowledge; House of Quality; Indonesia; Knowledge flow; Knowledge management system; Maturity levels; Maturity model; Quality control
